name: Dungeon Cartographer
description:
An old personal passion project with the sole purpose of forcing me to create physical maps to visualize the dungeon layout. I always loved the mazelike feel of oldschool 3D dungeon crawlers, so I decided to make my own endless dungeon crawler with procedurally generated levels.

Features:

Endless procedurally generated levels

No in-game maps, grab some paper to map it yourself!

Loot: Armor, weapons, potions, keys, and gold!

Score value of levels completed once you die

Contols:

WASD to move

Hold I to view inventory

Mouse left and right click in combat

Left click to pick up an item, right click to discard it

R to restart game

ESC to save and quit, game will automatically start where you left off

Unfinished:

As an older project primarily made for personal enjoyment, I have no plans to make this into a polished game. Elements of the game may look unpolished, but it is all fully playable.

This game isn't for everyone, but if you're in the mood to map some grid-based dungeons, break out that graph paper!
